name: Sluggers World Class Sports Bar
description: Wrigleyville's premier sports bar since 1985, featuring 30+ HD screens, batting cages, and an arcade on the second floor, steps from Wrigley Field.

name: Murphy's Bleachers
description: Historic Cubs bar directly across from the Wrigley Field bleacher entrance, open since 1980, with a rooftop patio and classic pub fare.

name: Timothy O'Toole's Pub
description: Chicago's favorite sports bar since 1992 near Michigan Avenue, featuring 72 HD TVs and a full sports package showing 40+ games daily.

name: Joe's Bar on Weed St
description: Chicago's largest sports bar at 20,000 sq ft with 100+ TVs in a warehouse-style venue near Lincoln Park.

name: The Barn Hockey Bar
description: Hockey-dedicated bar near the United Center named after the old Chicago Stadium nickname, with 50 TVs and Blackhawks memorabilia.

name: Ranalli's West Loop
description: Pizza bar and official Blackhawks bar near the United Center with a dog-friendly patio and free shuttles to United Center events.

name: Hawkeye's Bar and Grill
description: Neighborhood sports bar in University Village open since 1987, official Blackhawks bar and go-to for Bears and White Sox fans on the Near West Side.

name: Reggie's Chicago
description: South Loop bar and grill with 21 TVs, 70+ craft beers, award-winning wings, and a rooftop deck; offers free buses to White Sox, Bears, and Blackhawks games.

name: Mother Hubbard's Sports Pub
description: River North sports pub with 45+ TVs and multiple satellite feeds; official Blackhawks bar and a Bears and Bulls watching staple.

name: First Draft
description: South Loop craft beer bar with 23 large-screen TVs and a full DirecTV sports package; official Blackhawks bar.

name: Benchmark
description: Old Town two-floor sports bar with 40+ screens, tavern pizza, and Chicago's first fully retractable rooftop bar.

name: Broken Barrel Bar
description: Lincoln Park chef-driven sports bar and beer garden with house-smoked meats, rotating craft taps, and a heated year-round patio.

name: Jake Melnick's Corner Tap
description: Near Mag Mile sports bar famous since 2002 for nationally acclaimed chicken wings, BBQ, and full multi-sport TV coverage.

name: Cody's Public House
description: Lakeview neighborhood dive bar open since 1986 with a large dog-friendly beer garden and official Blackhawks bar designation.

name: The Pony Inn
description: Lakeview sports bar with a retractable rooftop, multiple screens, free popcorn, and official Bears, Blackhawks, and Bulls watch party events.

name: DraftKings Sportsbook at Wrigley Field
description: Premier sports entertainment venue inside Wrigley Field with a 2,000 sq ft LED display, 300 seats, 25 simultaneous games, and in-person sports betting.

name: Kirkwood Bar & Grill
description: Lakeview multi-screen sports venue with 35+ TVs and stadium seating near Wrigley Field, drawing strong Cubs and Bears crowds.

name: Theory
description: Upscale River North sports lounge with 35+ TVs and elevated cocktails; an official Chicago Blackhawks bar.
